alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Natrona County through 315 PM MDT... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Wall, which is also 23 miles southwest of Kaycee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. Funnel cloud possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Red Wall around 255 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations
